title: sanctification
comment: The process of becoming consecrated to God, which is an integral aspect of being a member of the people of God. This process of being made holy through the work of the Holy Spirit ultimately rests upon the sacrificial death of Jesus Christ, which the OT anticipates and foreshadows.

children.title: sanctification, nature and basis of
children.comment: The process of renewal and consecration by which believers are made holy through the work of the Holy Spirit. Sanctification is the consequence of justification and is dependent upon a person being in a right relationship with God.

children.title: Sanctification is grounded in the holiness of God
God demands that his people should reflect his holiness
Sanctification is the will of God for his people
The atoning death of Jesus Christ
The work of the Holy Spirit
Enslavement to evil can only be broken through the death of Jesus Christ
The need for renewal and growth
A process which has already been initiated
A process of growth in holiness
sanctification, means and results of
children.comment: Sanctification results from the renewing work of the Holy Spirit and leads to the renewal of believers and their being equipped for ministry in the world.

children.title: The work of the Holy Spirit
The active pursuit of holiness and righteousness
Blamelessness in the sight of God
